suppress.notes: Spark is suppressed as the version we are able to use is restricted by support in AWS EMR: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/emr-release-components.html

Spark is suppressed as the version we are able to use is restricted by support in AWS EMR: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/emr-release-components.html
Some of the Spark dependencies were not identified by the Spark CPE, so we've added this to catch several shaded dependencies.

Arrow is used in the state store and standard ingest, and is also a dependency of Spark. Because it's a dependency of Spark, the version we're able to use is restricted by support in AWS EMR.
This affects the Arrow R package, which we don't use internally. It doesn't seem to affect the Arrow implementations that we use.
This was found against Arrow 12.0.1.
Hadoop is suppressed as the version we are able to use is restricted by support in AWS EMR: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/emr-release-components.html

Hadoop is suppressed as the version we are able to use is restricted by support in AWS EMR: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/emr-release-components.html
Hadoop uses a shaded version of Protobuf with vulnerabilities.

Hadoop is suppressed as the version we are able to use is restricted by support in AWS EMR: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/emr-release-components.html
Some of the Hadoop dependencies were not identified by the Hadoop CPE, so we've added this to catch several shaded dependencies.
The version of Athena we're using uses an old version of Bouncy Castle Provider, with an old Maven artifact that doesn't have a fixed version.
The AWS CDK uses Javascript code with a vulnerable NPM package. Once there's a version of the CDK that doesn't, we can use that instead.
The AWS CDK uses a vulnerable Ruby gem. Once there's a version of the CDK that doesn't, we can use that instead.

At time of writing, the latest version of Avro IPC uses an old version of jQuery in its static pages for stats. We don't expose that page, so it won't be a problem. This is a provided dependency for the module bulk-import/bulk-import-runner.
This seems to be a false positive as the CVE is for the Go implementation of Avro, which we're not using.
Spark SQL integrates with Apache Hive, but we don't use it.

Bouncy Castle is a dependency for Athena. We also use the library in the build module but we use a more recent version that is not vulnerable.
Athena declares a dependency on an old Maven artifact targeted at JDK 1.5, and there's no updated version of that artifact.

Apfloat is used in the build module by JUNG for visualising dependencies between Maven modules. This is not used in production code, and there is not a more up to date version that does not have this problem.

This dependency is only used by WireMock, which is only used for tests. The CVE also seems to incorrectly match the version we're using. It's listed as having arised in version 12.0.0, and we're using 9.4.57 at time of writing.

This dependency is only used by WireMock, which is only used for tests.
file name: http2-common-11.0.25.jar

This dependency is brought in through Trino, and our Trino plugin is currently experimental. To upgrade Trino we also need to upgrade Java. AWS EMR does not yet support using Apache Spark with versions of Java beyond 17, so we are not currently able to upgrade.

DOMPurify is only used by WireMock, which is only used for tests. We're not able to upgrade to a later version of WireMock that doesn't use this. Later versions of WireMock use Jetty 11 or 12, and the version of Hadoop we're using uses Jetty 9.

This is a false positive which is only used for testing, given that it is a dependency of WireMock. Dependabot should update it automatically when a fixed version is available. file name: xmlunit-core-2.10.3.jar
